subject_terms_3: G. R. Lambert & Co. Portrait photography Pioneers Seah, Liang Seah Straits Chinese British Association Chinese costumes
physical_appearance: "The image shows a photograph that is light brown in colour. A black-and-white portrait of a man is displayed. He is wearing a changshan and a mandarin cap. He is looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. The studio mark ""G.R. Lambert & Co"" and ""Singapore"" are displayed at the bottom"
sgcool_label_text:
This photograph is a portrait of Seah Liang Seah. Printed on the card is the studio mark ‘G R Lambert & Co.’. 

Seah Liang Seah was a prominent leader of the Teochew community, one of the founding members of the Straits Chinese British Association, and successor to Whampoa on the Straits Legislative Council, to name but a few of his accomplishments. He was the son of the early Teochew leader Seah Eu Chin.
